content: Calculate the perimeter of a square with a side length of 9 meters.

To calculate the perimeter of a square, you can use the formula:

\[ \text{Perimeter} = 4 \times \text{side length} \]

Given that the side length is 9 meters, the perimeter would be:

\[ \text{Perimeter} = 4 \times 9 = 36 \text{ meters} \]

So, the perimeter of the square is 36 meters.
